channel.title: BBC News - Europe
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Afghan evacuee boy who ate poisonous mushrooms dies in Poland
item.description: The five year old ate the mushrooms at a refugee centre near Warsaw after his evacuation from Kabul.

item.title: Inger Stoejberg: Danish ex-immigration minister faces impeachment trial
item.description: Inger Stoejberg is accused of unlawfully ordering the separation of young asylum-seeking couples.

item.title: Mikis Theodorakis, composer of Zorba the Greek, dies aged 96
item.description: Mikis Theodorakis was also a key figure of resistance to the Greek military junta of the 1970s.

item.title: Spain hit with severe flooding after storm
item.description: Homes in north and central Spain are left isolated and without electricity as roads are forced to close.

item.title: WhatsApp issued second-largest GDPR fine of €225m
item.description: The Irish data watchdog has handed WhatsApp the second-highest ever GDPR fine.

item.title: Ronaldo breaks men's international goal record
item.description: Cristiano Ronaldo breaks the world record for goals scored in men's international football with two headers against the Republic of Ireland.

item.title: Brexit: Rules for moving goods from NI to GB delayed
item.description: The rules govern which goods qualify for "unfettered access" when moving them from NI to GB.

item.title: Mr Zelensky (finally) goes to Washington
item.description: The Ukrainian president pressed by Donald Trump gets his White House visit - and a new set of worries.

item.title: Sarah Rainsford: My last despatch before Russian expulsion
item.description: The BBC's Moscow correspondent files her final despatch after more than 20 years reporting in Russia.

item.title: Nigerian students amass degrees to stay in Europe
item.description: Modupe Osunkoya enrolled on her third post-graduate degree because she says there are no jobs at home.

item.title: Brexit: What next for the Northern Ireland Protocol?
item.description: NI's economy minister says there will be "real problems" if grace periods expire on 1 October.

item.title: Young Afghan mayor who fled Taliban hidden in car
item.description: One of Afghanistan's first female mayors, Zarifa Ghafari, describes her dramatic escape to Germany.

item.title: German elections 2021: Simple guide to vote ending Merkel era
item.description: Next month, Germans choose a new government. This is how the vote works.

item.title: Stalin-era mass grave found in Ukraine
item.description: Thousands of people are thought to be buried at the site - one of the largest ever found in Ukraine.

item.title: Irish society 'can begin to hope again', says Micheál Martin
item.description: The Taoiseach (Irish prime minister) announces plan to end most Covid-19 restrictions by 22 October.

item.title: Feminist Collages London: Tackling violence against women with slogan posters
item.description: A movement that started in Paris, has now spread into locations across the globe.

item.title: Greta Thunberg: 'I'll go to COP26 if it's safe and democratic'
item.description: Swedish climate activist Greta Thunberg says she does not think November's COP26 summit in Glasgow will lead to "much results".

item.title: Milan fire: Flames engulf modern 20-storey block of flats
item.description: The tower is only 10 years old and questions are being asked about how the fire spread so dramatically.

item.title: Turkey lockdown: Pigeon-keeping in Istanbul on the rise
item.description: The ancient art of pigeon fancying, popular across Asia, enjoyed resurgence during the pandemic.
